item.title: Paramount第1四半期：売上高は前年同期比1%減の$7.3B、$1.23Bの損失、ストリーミング売上高は前年同期比39%増の$15B、$511Mの損失、Paramount+は410万加入を追加して合計60Mに (Lucas Manfredi/The Wrap)
item.description:
Lucas Manfredi / The Wrap:
Paramount Q1: revenue down 1% YoY to $7.3B and a $1.23B loss; streaming revenue up 39% YoY to $1.5B and a $511M loss; Paramount+ added 4.1M subs for 60M total  —  The media giant slashed its dividend 79% as it posted adjusted earnings per share of 9 cents on revenue of $7.3 billion for the first quarter, missing Wall Street estimates

item.title: The Stopgapブログのクリエイターである作家のDaniel LaveryとJo Livingstoneに、楽しいウェブサイトの開始、ニュースレター、作家のためのチップジャーの使用などについてQ&A（Laura Hazard Owen/Nieman Lab)
item.description:
Laura Hazard Owen / Nieman Lab:
Q&A with writers Daniel Lavery and Jo Livingstone, creators of The Stopgap blog, on starting a fun website, newsletters, using tip jars for writers, and more  —  “Not to brag, but if there was an obvious way to make money here I feel like I would know about it.”

item.title: 連帯を示すため、WGAはDGA、SAG-AFTRA、IATSE、Teamsters、その他6つのギルドのメンバーと共にロサンゼルスで集会を開いた（Ross A. Lincoln/The Wrap）。
item.description:
Ross A. Lincoln / The Wrap:
In a show of solidarity, the WGA was joined by members of the DGA, SAG-AFTRA, IATSE, Teamsters, and six other guilds at a Los Angeles rally  —  Participants included SAG, DGA, IATSE, the Teamsters, and more  —  In a massive show of solidarity, on day 2 of the ongoing Writers' strike …

item.title: GoogleとMetaの幹部は、オンラインニュース法案が可決された場合、彼らのプラットフォームがカナダでのニュース記事へのアクセスを撤回すると述べている（Sam Jabri-Pickett/Reuters)
item.description:
Sam Jabri-Pickett / Reuters:
Google and Meta executives say their platforms would withdraw access to news articles in Canada if the proposed Online News Act passes  —  Google and Meta would withdraw access to news articles in Canada if legislation compelling internet companies to pay news publishers is passed …

item.title: USAIDのサマンサ・パワー代表は、声を封じることを目的とした法的脅威から世界のジャーナリストを守るプログラム「Reporters Shield」の立ち上げを発表した（Michelle Nichols/Reuters)
item.description:
Michelle Nichols / Reuters:
USAID head Samantha Power announces the launch of Reporters Shield, a program to defend journalists globally from legal threats aimed at silencing voices  —  The United States on Tuesday launched a program to defend journalists around the world from legal threats aimed at silencing critical voices …

item.title: 情報源NBCUniversalは、18-49歳の視聴者を対象としたニュースネットワークであるLXを2023年半ばにシャットダウンする。
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Sources: NBCUniversal will shutter LX, its news network aimed at viewers ages 18-49, in mid-2023; ~40 affected workers are being considered for other NBCU jobs  —  EXCLUSIVE: NBCUniversal is winding down LX, a 3-year-old network with the stated mission of delivering viewers “the stories you need with more sass and less suits.”

item.title: Twitterが2024年夏季オリンピックに向けてNBCUとの提携範囲を拡大すると発表、Snapは5月1日にNBCUと同様の取り組みを発表（Dade Hayes/Deadline)
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Twitter announces it is expanding the scope of its partnership with NBCU for the 2024 Summer Olympics; Snap announced a similar initiative with NBCU on May 1  —  Despite all of the upheaval at Twitter under new owner Elon Musk in recent months, the social media firm and NBCUniversal …

item.title: 法廷資料：Inc.とFast Companyの出版社の人事トップが会社から429Kドル以上を盗んだとされ、2023年4月に解雇、5月1日に逮捕（Max Tani/Semafor)
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Court docs: the top HR exec at the publisher of Inc. and Fast Company allegedly stole $429K+ from the company; she was fired in April 2023 and arrested on May 1  —  The Scoop  —  The top human resources executive at the publisher of Inc Magazine and Fast Company allegedly stole more than $429,000 …

item.title: ドナルド・トランプがニューヨーク・タイムズと姪のメアリー・トランプを相手取り、彼の納税記録を入手するための「陰湿な陰謀」を主張した訴訟を判事が投げ出す（Lachlan Cartwright/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Lachlan Cartwright / The Daily Beast:
A judge tosses out Donald Trump's lawsuit against The New York Times and his niece Mary Trump, in which he alleged an “insidious plot” to obtain his tax records  —  Trump sued the paper, along with his niece Mary, alleging an “insidious plot” to grab his tax records and publish them in a Pulitzer-winning report.

item.title: ダウ・ジョーンズは、ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル、バロンズ、マーケットウォッチ、インベスターズ・ビジネス・デイリーのコンテンツを含むストリーミング・ラジオ・チャンネルをTuneInで開設する予定です（Matthew Keys/The Desk）。
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
Dow Jones plans to launch a streaming radio channel on TuneIn with content from The Wall Street Journal, Barron's, MarketWatch, and Investor's Business Daily  —  The service will offer around-the-clock audio programming from the Wall Street Journal and its sister publications.  —  By: Matthew KeysMay 3, 2023,

item.title: IABのレポート：ソーシャルビデオやコネクテッドTVを含む米国のデジタルビデオ広告費は、2022年に前年比21％増の471億ドル、2023年には17％増の552億ドルになると予測（Karlene Lukovitz/MediaPost）
item.description:
Karlene Lukovitz / MediaPost:
IAB report: US digital video ad spend, including social video and connected TV, rose 21% YoY to $47.1B in 2022 and is projected to rise 17% to $55.2B in 2023  —  U.S. digital video ad spend increased 21% in 2022, to $47.1 billion, and is projected to rise 17% in 2023, to $55.2 billion …

item.title: ストライキを起こしたWGAのライターたちは、自分たちの作品がトレーニングデータとして使われることと、AIが生成した「ずさんな初稿」を直すだけの仕事をさせられるという、AIに関する2つの大きな悩みを抱えている（Benj Edwards/Ars Technica）。
item.description:
Benj Edwards / Ars Technica:
Striking WGA writers have two main worries about AI: their work being used as training data and being tasked with just fixing AI-generated “sloppy first drafts”  —  WGA writers don't want to train AI or clean up AI-generated “sloppy first drafts.”

item.title: デトロイト・フリー・プレスは、非営利団体チョークビートの編集長を2年間務めた後、ニコル・アベリー・ニコルズを新しい編集長に任命した（JC Reindl/Detroit Free Press）。
item.description:
JC Reindl / Detroit Free Press:
Detroit Free Press names Nicole Avery Nichols as its new top editor, returning to the outlet after a two-year stint as editor-in-chief of nonprofit Chalkbeat  —  Nicole Avery Nichols, who has reported and edited news in Detroit for more than 25 years, leading coverage that has ranged …

item.title: Sinclair Broadcast Group、第1四半期の売上高は前年同期比40%減の$773M、Diamond Sports Groupと多数のBally Sportsチャンネルの運用難が主因 (Matthew Keys/Fierce Video)
item.description:
Matthew Keys / Fierce Video:
Sinclair Broadcast Group reports Q1 revenue down 40% YoY to $773M, largely due to operational woes at Diamond Sports Group and its many Bally Sports channels  —  Sinclair quarterly earnings Diamond Sports regional sports network (RSN)  —  The bankrupt cluster of regional sports channels operated …

item.title: TikTok、Condé Nast、BuzzFeed、NBCなど一部のパブリッシャーが投稿と一緒に広告を販売し、収益の50%を確保できる「Pulse Premiere」を発表（Alexandra Bruell/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Alexandra Bruell / Wall Street Journal:
TikTok announces Pulse Premiere, which lets select publishers, such as Condé Nast, BuzzFeed, and NBC, sell ads alongside their posts and keep 50% of the revenue  —  New product will let publishers sell ads alongside their posts and take home half the revenue
